name: Lily Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Lily Beach from 13 - 21 May 2011. It was beyond what we
reviews.title: Worlds Away
Paradise
reviews.text: expected. The Platinum All Inclusive Plan was exactly that which they said it would be.

It includes all your drinks, coffees, teas, A la Carte lunch at Aqua Bar, snacks, you name it. The resort itself is of a very high standard. Our room was cleaned twice a day. We stayed in a Beach Villa which was fabulous as you get to experience the sand and the sea! It was situated between the beautiful trees and shrubs, with a view of the famously blue water. A must do: The ocean adventure. This is not included as a free excursion and costs $150 per person, but it's well worth it! We snorkeled with Manta Rays and a massive whale shark! An unforgettable experience. The fish are amazing! Tip: Put lots of sunscreen on your back if you enjoy snorkeling - hours facing down in the water can cause a bit of a problem if you are fair skinned. The sunsets... Make sure you go to the Aqua Bar around 5:30 to get your cocktail and watch the sun go down! Overall, this resort is fabulous, and the staff's attention to detail is worth praising. Sena (At the bar) - thanks for my wonderful Pina Coladas! The best I ever had. And to Briam, who attended our Villa, it was 5 star! Thoufa, our guest relations lady, thanks for all the info and taking the time to assist us with our queries. We'll be back
reviews.title: Pampered in Paradise

reviews.text: I stayed there with my fiancee for a week. We were kindly upgraded upon arrival to a water villas. Our stay there was the best time of my life. The swimming pool of the villa was the place we did not want to leave and the bathroom was just superb. The staff is really nice, the all inclusive is a real all inclusive option which includes the mini bar and that is rare enought to notice. The breakfast was the biggest one i ever had in my life. I hope i could go back there one day.
reviews.title: Pure perfection :-)))

reviews.text: Thanks again to my fiancee for that dream..

reviews.text: ACCOMMODATION
reviews.title: Amazing honeymoon in paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a beach villa - 165 - in the area of the island we had requested when we booked. It was a very good size and the location was perfect, just yards from the beach, close to the restaurant and one of the bars. The outdoor bathroom was fabulous, although the wall of heat that hits you as you walk out of the air conditioned room can be a bit of a shock! The beach villas have a better view as they just look out to sea, whereas on the other side where the lagoon villas are located there is another island quite close by. We did consider upgrading to a water villa for one night but decided against having looked at them as we couldn't justify the cost.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway... Couldn't fault a thing

reviews.text: SERVICE
reviews.title: You don't know what you are missing until you get here!

reviews.text: The staff are absolutely amazing and cannot do enough for you. From the person who made up our room twice a day through to the waiter in the Aqva bar who always told us where the wine we'd ordered was from and even the maintenance staff, it really was service with a smile and couldn't be faulted. The resort manager was always walking around the island, although he did seem to pay some people more attention than others - we witnessed him talking to one particular family several times and overheard him offering them an upgrade to a water villa for the night.
reviews.title: The best Madlivian holiday so far&we have been on 3 previous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What els can I say nothing but pure perfect start to finish .
reviews.title: Was a amazing honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 week stay at Lily Beach. We first went there for our honeymoon 16 years ago and it has changed for the better beyond all recognition. We had one of the deluxe water villas, which I would definitely recommend. No mosquitoes for starters! Having your own private deck and plunge pool was fabulous and straight down the steps and onto the house reef for snorkelling. We are both keen divers and the staff at the dive centre were superb - very efficient and all incredibly friendly. A real mix of dives and we were also able to snorkel with manta rays and a whale shark. Fantastic experiences! The food and drink is of a very high standard for all-inclusive and I cannot fault the staff in the bars and restaurants - very friendly and could not do enough for us.
reviews.title: Great Resort, great holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was beautiful - we had a hot stone massage, whilst looking down into the ocean and the beautiful marine life!
reviews.title: Fantastic resort for snorkelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that, during our stay, the hotel was predominantly full of Chinese and Koreans. Unfortunately, we found them incredibly loud and very rude, which was a real shame.
reviews.title: A trip to paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, a fantastic resort and a great holiday.
reviews.title: Delightful honeymoon

reviews.text: We spent 10 nights at this beautiful resort with our daughter aged 2,5. We stayed in a beach villa next to the restaurant, which we found very useful having our little daughter with us. The room has everything you need, including a jacuzzi in the open air bathroom. The only thing which should be improved is that there is just one small closet in the room, so there is not enough space to have everything in order.
reviews.title: Just a dream!

reviews.text: The resort operates with an excellent all inclusive service, which allows you to go to the main restaurant (very good buffet with international choices), but also to two à la carte outlets by the pools (not open at dinner). In addition you have the possibility to dine once or twice by the Tamarind restaurant, incredible chinese and indian restaurant by the sea.
reviews.title: Paradise exists!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The qualiy of food and beverage is very very good and all the staff is extremely helpful and courteous, especially with kids. The all including plan allows you to have bottled drinks, mini bar, water sport equipment and so on. You really don't have to bother bringing with you many things, you will find everything you need. You also have free internet access.
reviews.title: Flawless fantasy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a kids club, with plenty of toys (also for the beach) and the lady is really nice; she took care of my daughter, even though she is not even three, and we had the possibility of having some free time for us occasionally.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort. Cant wait till we return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet in the main restaurant has a kids corner, so you don't have to worry if you have children.
reviews.title: Just absolutely gorgeous!

description: ---UNDERGOING UPGRADES--- In the deep blue sea of the Indian Ocean, among the scattered small Islands known as the Garland of Flowers (Maldive Islands) of indescribable nature, Lily Beach Resort is the island - Huvahendhoo at the South East Ari-Atoll.
